intro: Plagiogyria egenolfioides var. latipinna, commonly known as the broad-needle plagiogyria, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a thalloid structure with a distinct, flat, greenish-green thallus that is often covered in small, rounded lobes. Its reproductive structures, known as sorocarps, are borne on short stalks and contain the spores. This variety is relatively rare and is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
